intro: Liabum vernonioides, commonly known as the slender liabum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Liabum vernonioides is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
